context: Traditional automotive manufacturer evaluating investment in electric vehicle platform development to compete in growing EV market, facing pressure from new EV-only competitors and regulatory requirements

request.purpose: Develop dedicated electric vehicle platform and manufacturing capabilities
request.justification: EV market expected to reach 40% of global sales by 2030, current ICE platform insufficient for competitive EV offerings

decision_process.outcome: Identified $180B global EV market opportunity with 25% CAGR
Feasible with 24-month development timeline leveraging existing engineering expertise
Projected 18% IRR with break-even in year 4
Secured preliminary agreements with key battery suppliers
Platform designed to meet 2025 emission standards and qualify for $7,500 tax credits
Approved with phased investment approach and performance milestones

business_impact.expected_outcome: Launch 3 EV models by 2028, capture 8% EV market share, achieve carbon neutrality by 2040
strategic_benefits: New revenue streams from battery technology licensing

lessons_learned: Cross-functional collaboration essential for complex platform development, early supplier engagement critical for supply chain security
